question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What academic degree did Hannes Adomeit hold in 1995?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Title: The Academic Pursuits of Hannes Adomeit: A German Political Scientist

In the realm of German academia, few names resonate as profoundly as Hannes Adomeit, a renowned political scientist whose illustrious career has been marked by a deep understanding of the intricacies of international relations and geopolitics. As we delve into the life and achievements of this esteemed scholar, one aspect of his academic pedigree stands out: Hannes Adomeit holds the academic degree of Diplom, a distinction that has been a cornerstone of his remarkable journey. To comprehend the significance of Adomeit's Diplom, it is essential to understand the context in which he pursued his academic endeavors. In Germany, the Diplom is an academic degree that has been a staple of higher education for centuries. This prestigious degree is typically awarded to students who have completed a comprehensive program of study, often lasting several years, in a specific field or discipline. The Diplom is highly regarded in German-speaking countries, and its holders are recognized for their expertise and mastery of their chosen subject. Hannes Adomeit's academic pursuits began in the 1960s, a tumultuous period in German history marked by the Cold War and the country's gradual reconstruction. It was during this time that Adomeit developed a fascination with political science, driven by a desire to understand the complex dynamics of international relations and their impact on global politics. His academic curiosity led him to enroll in a prestigious German university, where he embarked on a rigorous program of study that would ultimately culminate in the awarding of his Diplom. Adomeit's academic record is replete with evidence of his exceptional scholarship and dedication to his craft. Throughout his studies, he demonstrated a remarkable aptitude for political analysis, consistently producing work that was characterized by its depth, nuance, and insight. His academic prowess did not go unnoticed, and he soon established himself as one of the most promising young scholars in his field. The awarding of Adomeit's Diplom was a testament to his academic excellence and a recognition of his mastery of political science. This esteemed degree not only validated his academic achievements but also served as a springboard for his future success. With his Diplom in hand, Adomeit was poised to make a significant impact in the world of academia, and his subsequent career would be marked by a series of accomplishments that would cement his reputation as a leading authority in his field.
content.source_2: In the year 2029, Hannes Adomeit stood at the threshold of a new chapter in his academic journey. On May 17th, he received the esteemed degree of archivist palaeographer from the prestigious Ecole Nationale des Chartes, a renowned institution in the heart of Paris. This milestone marked the culmination of years of dedication and hard work, as Hannes had poured his heart and soul into mastering the intricacies of archival science and palaeography. As he walked out of the historic building, diploma in hand, Hannes felt a sense of pride and accomplishment wash over him. He knew that this degree would open doors to new opportunities, allowing him to make a meaningful impact in the world of political science. The date, May 17th, 2029, was etched in his memory as a turning point, a moment that would shape the trajectory of his future. Over the next two years, Hannes immersed himself in the world of political science, applying his skills as an archivist palaeographer to uncover hidden gems in the archives of history. He delved deep into the dusty tomes and crumbling manuscripts, unearthing secrets and shedding new light on the complexities of human politics. His work took him to the farthest corners of the globe, from the ancient libraries of Alexandria to the modern archives of Berlin. As the days turned into weeks, and the weeks into months, Hannes's reputation grew. He became known for his meticulous attention to detail, his ability to decipher the most obscure scripts, and his passion for uncovering the truth. His work was met with acclaim, and he was soon in high demand as a consultant and researcher. But as the clock ticked closer to June 11th, 2031, Hannes began to feel a sense of restlessness. He knew that his time as an archivist palaeographer was limited, and that a new chapter was waiting to unfold. He had accomplished so much, but he was not yet ready to rest on his laurels. The future beckoned, full of possibilities and uncertainties. As the sun set on June 11th, 2031, Hannes closed the door on this phase of his life, his degree now a testament to his past achievements. He looked out into the unknown, his heart pounding with excitement, as he wondered what the future held for him.
